Player History
Drafted in 1st round, 8th overall pick, by Syracuse in 1971...
Had first career hit (double) on 4/3/1973, off Bill Clark (LYN)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/1/1973, off Herbert Almond (WT)...
Won Slick Fielder Award at Third Base in 1973...
Injured on 4/5/1975 with a Torn Hip Muscle, out for 4-5 weeks...
Won Player of the Week award on 6/30/1976, hitting .476 with 3 HR, 6 RBI...
Drove in 8 runs against Lynchburg on 8/29/1979...
Was selected to the 1982 Allstar game...
Signed as a free agent by Pontiac on 2/2/1983 to a 3-year deal worth $5,893,800 per year...
Injured on 6/12/1983 with a Inflamed Posterior Cruciate Ligament, out for 3 weeks...
Won World Championship with Pontiac in 1983...
Was selected to the 1984 Allstar game...
